recipes.name: Sheet Pan Autumn Root Vegetable Roast
recipes.description: A hearty, colorful medley of roasted root vegetables and squash tossed in a balsamic-herb glaze. This dish highlights the natural sweetness of the radishes and delicata squash.
recipes.ingredients_available: 1 bunch Red Turnips, 1 Green Meat Radish, 1 Bordeaux Radish, 1 bunch Carrots, 1 Delicata Squash, 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes, 1 bunch Japanese Negi Scallions, 1 bunch Parsley
recipes.reason: This recipe uses all your requested "roast" ingredients in a classic American preparation that celebrates the harvest.
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Scrub and dice 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes and 1 bunch Carrots into 1-inch chunks.
3. Slice 1 Delicata Squash in half, remove seeds, and cut into half-moons (no need to peel).
4. Quarter 1 bunch Red Turnips, and dice 1 Green Meat Radish and 1 Bordeaux Radish into 1-inch cubes.
5. Toss all vegetables on a large sheet pan with 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp dried thyme.
6. Roast for 30-35 minutes until tender and browned.
7. Slice 1 bunch Japanese Negi Scallions into 1-inch pieces and toss them onto the pan for the last 10 minutes of roasting.
8. Garnish with 1/2 cup chopped fresh Parsley and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar before serving.

recipes.name: Savoy Cabbage and Potato Gratin
recipes.description: A comforting American-style baked casserole featuring tender layers of cabbage and thinly sliced potatoes in a creamy garlic sauce.
recipes.ingredients_available: 1 Savoy Cabbage, 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes, 1 Yellow Onion, 1 bunch Parsley
recipes.ingredients_needed: 2 cups Whole Milk, 1 cup Shredded Cheddar Cheese
recipes.reason: This utilizes your Savoy cabbage and potatoes in a classic, filling dinner format.
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Thinly slice 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes and 1 Yellow Onion.
3. Core and shred 1 Savoy Cabbage into 1/2-inch strips.
4. In a large skillet, sauté the onion and cabbage with 2 tbsp oil for 8-10 minutes until wilted.
5. In a greased baking dish, layer half the potatoes, then the cabbage mixture, then the remaining potatoes.
6. Whisk 2 cups Whole Milk with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp garlic powder; pour over the vegetables.
7. Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes.
8. Remove foil, sprinkle with 1 cup Shredded Cheddar Cheese, and bake for another 15 minutes until bubbly and golden.
9. Top with 1/4 cup chopped fresh Parsley.

recipes.name: Braised Leeks and Greens with Crispy Potatoes
recipes.description: Sautéed leeks and kale served alongside golden pan-fried potatoes for a simple, nutritious American bistro-style dinner.
recipes.ingredients_available: 1 bunch Leeks, 1 bunch Kale, 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes, 1 Red Onion
recipes.reason: This recipe incorporates the leeks and kale while providing protein via the needed chickpeas.
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes into small 1/2-inch cubes. Boil in salted water for 8 minutes, drain, and pat dry.
2. In a large skillet, fry the potatoes in 3 tbsp oil until crispy and golden (about 10 minutes); set aside.
3. Clean and slice 1 bunch Leeks (white and light green parts) and thinly slice 1 Red Onion.
4. Sauté leeks and onions in 2 tbsp oil for 5 minutes until soft.
5. Add 1 bunch torn Kale leaves (stems removed) and 1 drained can of Chickpeas to the skillet.
6. Add 1/4 cup water or vegetable broth, cover, and steam for 5-7 minutes until kale is tender.
7. Stir the crispy potatoes back into the greens and season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice or vinegar.

recipes.name: Hearty Vegetable and Potato Chowder
recipes.description: A thick and creamy vegetable soup packed with potatoes, carrots, and scallions, perfect for a cold evening.
recipes.ingredients_available: 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes, 1 bunch Carrots, 1 bunch Japanese Negi Scallions, 1 Yellow Onion, 1 bunch Parsley
recipes.ingredients_needed: 4 cups Vegetable Broth, 1 cup Heavy Cream
recipes.reason: This uses your staples to create a classic American chowder that is both filling and vegetarian.
recipes.instructions:
1. Finely dice 1 Yellow Onion and 1 bunch Carrots.
2. Peel (optional) and cube 1 lb German Butterball Potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces.
3. In a large pot, sauté the onion and carrots in 2 tbsp oil for 6 minutes.
4. Add the potatoes and 4 cups Vegetable Broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15-20 minutes until potatoes are soft.
5. Use a potato masher to lightly crush some of the potatoes directly in the pot to thicken the soup.
6. Stir in 1 cup Heavy Cream and 1 bunch sliced Japanese Negi Scallions.
7. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season generously with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.
8. Serve hot, garnished with 1/4 cup chopped fresh Parsley.
